title: Excision and Sullivan King Reunite on Headbanger's Delight "Encore"
description: An unrelenting bass gauntlet marked by an iconic sample and escalating chaos, “Encore” is engineered for sweat-soaked festival crescendos.
author: Harrison Goldstein
excerpt: An unrelenting bass gauntlet marked by an iconic sample and escalating chaos, “Encore” is engineered for sweat-soaked festival crescendos.

html:
An unrelenting bass gauntlet marked by an iconic sample and escalating chaos, “Encore” is engineered for sweat-soaked festival crescendos.

An unrelenting bass gauntlet marked by an iconic sample and escalating chaos, “Encore” is engineered for sweat-soaked festival crescendos.

  • Home
  • MUSIC RELEASES

Fasten your seatbelts, because Excision and Sullivan King are back with another collaboration filled to the brim with bass-fueled turbulence. 

“Encore” is not coy about its intentions. The track opens with a surge of crowd noise—“One more song! One more song!”—a war cry both self-referential and entirely earned. Within seconds, that chant is obliterated by a boot-stomping kick drum and a serrated synth line, giving way to a distorted sample of Jay-Z’s unmistakable “Can I get an encore, do you want more?” That’s the listener's cue to brace themselves, because what follows is an unrelenting descent into decibel overload.

The first drop arrives with the subtlety of a wrecking ball. It’s a cacophony of low-end growls, layered with enough rhythmic scaffolding to keep bodies moving. A second drop follows closely behind, tailor-made to turn any dancefloor into a raucous pit. Drop number three represents a shift into high-speed mayhem, bludgeoning the tempo into a new gear. The track is a ceaselessly ferocious adventure that represents the best of both artists' talents.

Excision and Sullivan King have a long-standing rapport, forged in previous chaos like "Codename: Reckless,” “Our Fire,” and “Bass to the Dome,” among others. Their chemistry here isn’t accidental; instead, it’s the result of years of calibrating joint sonic demolition.

Scroll to Continue

Recommended Articles

This marks Excision’s third output of the year, following “INSANE” with SVDDEN DEATH and yvm3, as well as “Air” with Gryffin and Julia Michaels. Sullivan King has been on his own warpath in 2025, surfacing with his CHAOS WILL BRING PEACE EP and a string of collaborative singles that continue to sharpen his genre-fusing edge.

You can stream "Encore" below.
